remarks: The closure of a kernel is a hyperplane iff it doesn't contain all vectors.  (Contributed by NM, 1-Nov-2014.)
statement:
dochkrshp.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dochkrshp.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dochkrshp.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dochkrshp.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
dochkrshp.y $e |- Y = ( LSHyp ` U ) $.
dochkrshp.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
dochkrshp.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
dochkrshp.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
dochkrshp.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. F ) $.
dochkrshp $p |- ( ph -> ( ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` ( L ` G ) ) ) =/= V <-> ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` ( L ` G ) ) ) e. Y ) ) $.
